title: Workshop on Integrating Computer-Assisted Assessment (CAA) Techniques in Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics theory and college-level problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: A short-term intensive course for pre-service/in-service teachers to apply CAA technology in practical contexts, designed for professional learners. Conducted in a BYOD environment with formative assessments using real-time collaboration tools and the STACK platform.

learning_goals: Learners can design STACK-based assessment items classified into three types
Learners can understand and apply automated scoring algorithms for mathematical problem-solving

Learners analyze five technical requirements (e.g., real-time feedback processing, item difficulty adjustment algorithms, LMS integration APIs) of a Computerized Adaptive Assessment (CAA) system within one week. They draft a requirements specification document and receive "Met or Exceeded" evaluations from ≥2 of 3 instructor/peer reviewers.

Learners analyze ≥3 limitations of traditional assessment methods using CAA technology (e.g., automated scoring algorithms, adaptive item systems). They submit a hybrid assessment design addressing these within one week, achieving ≥3 points (5-point scale) in validity, feasibility, and innovativeness criteria.

resources: BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) support guide

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
